intro: Merkusia molluginea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that can be either upright or trailing. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including shades of purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Merkusia molluginea is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
